params.name: state
params.description: Either `open`, `closed`, or `all` to filter by state.

params.name: head
params.description: Filter pulls by head user and branch name in the format of `user:ref-name`. Example: `github:new-script-format`.

params.name: base
params.description: Filter pulls by base branch name. Example: `gh-pages`.

params.name: sort
params.description: What to sort results by. Can be either `created`, `updated`, `popularity` (comment count) or `long-running` (age, filtering by pulls updated in the last month).

params.name: direction
params.description: The direction of the sort. Can be either `asc` or `desc`.
params.default: `desc` when sort is `created` or sort is not specified, otherwise `asc`

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

name: Get a single pull request
description:
Lists details of a pull request by providing its number.

When you get, [create](https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#create-a-pull-request), or [edit](https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#update-a-pull-request) a pull request, GitHub creates a merge commit to test whether the pull request can be automatically merged into the base branch. This test commit is not added to the base branch or the head branch. You can review the status of the test commit using the `mergeable` key. For more information, see "[Checking mergeability of pull requests](https://developer.github.com/v3/git/#checking-mergeability-of-pull-requests)".

The value of the `mergeable` attribute can be `true`, `false`, or `null`. If the value is `null`, then GitHub has started a background job to compute the mergeability. After giving the job time to complete, resubmit the request. When the job finishes, you will see a non-`null` value for the `mergeable` attribute in the response. If `mergeable` is `true`, then `merge_commit_sha` will be the SHA of the _test_ merge commit.

The value of the `merge_commit_sha` attribute changes depending on the state of the pull request. Before merging a pull request, the `merge_commit_sha` attribute holds the SHA of the _test_ merge commit. After merging a pull request, the `merge_commit_sha` attribute changes depending on how you merged the pull request:

*   If merged as a [merge commit](https://help.github.com/articles/about-merge-methods-on-github/), `merge_commit_sha` represents the SHA of the merge commit.
*   If merged via a [squash](https://help.github.com/articles/about-merge-methods-on-github/#squashing-your-merge-commits), `merge_commit_sha` represents the SHA of the squashed commit on the base branch.
*   If [rebased](https://help.github.com/articles/about-merge-methods-on-github/#rebasing-and-merging-your-commits), `merge_commit_sha` represents the commit that the base branch was updated to.

Pass the appropriate [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media/#commits-commit-comparison-and-pull-requests) to fetch diff and patch formats.

responses.description: Pass the appropriate [media type](/v3/media/#commits-commit-comparison-and-pull-requests) to fetch diff and patch formats.

name: Create a pull request

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the pull request.

params.name: head
params.description: The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace `head` with a user like this: `username:branch`.

params.name: base
params.description: The name of the branch you want the changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repository that requests a merge to a base of another repository.

params.name: body
params.description: The contents of the pull request.

params.name: maintainer_can_modify
params.description: Indicates whether [maintainers can modify](https://help.github.com/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork/) the pull request.

description: **Note:** To open a pull request in a public repository, you must have write access to the head or the source branch. For organization-owned repositories, you must be a member of the organization that owns the repository to open a pull request.

name: create a Pull Request from an existing Issue by passing an Issue number

params.name: issue
params.description: The issue number in this repository to turn into a Pull Request.

params.name: head
params.description: The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace `head` with a user like this: `username:branch`.

params.name: base
params.description: The name of the branch you want the changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repository that requests a merge to a base of another repository.

params.name: maintainer_can_modify
params.description: Indicates whether [maintainers can modify](https://help.github.com/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork/) the pull request.

description: **Note:** To open a pull request in a public repository, you must have write access to the head or the source branch. For organization-owned repositories, you must be a member of the organization that owns the repository to open a pull request.

name: Update a pull request

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the pull request.

params.name: body
params.description: The contents of the pull request.

params.name: state
params.description: State of this Pull Request. Either `open` or `closed`.

params.name: base
params.description: The name of the branch you want your changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot update the base branch on a pull request to point to another repository.

params.name: maintainer_can_modify
params.description: Indicates whether [maintainers can modify](https://help.github.com/articles/allowing-changes-to-a-pull-request-branch-created-from-a-fork/) the pull request.

description: **Note:** To open a pull request in a public repository, you must have write access to the head or the source branch. For organization-owned repositories, you must be a member of the organization that owns the repository to open a pull request.

name: List commits on a pull request

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: **Note:** The response includes a maximum of 250 commits. To receive a complete commit list for pull requests with more than 250 commits, use the [Commit List API](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/commits/#list-commits-on-a-repository).

name: List pull requests files

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: **Note:** The response includes a maximum of 300 files.

name: Get if a pull request has been merged

params.name: commit_title
params.description: Title for the automatic commit message.

params.name: commit_message
params.description: Extra detail to append to automatic commit message.

params.name: sha
params.description: SHA that pull request head must match to allow merge.

params.name: merge_method
params.description: Merge method to use. Possible values are `merge`, `squash` or `rebase`. Default is `merge`.

name: List reviews on a pull request

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: The list of reviews returns in chronological order.

body.body: Here is the body for the review.

responses.description: The list of reviews returns in chronological order.

name: Get comments for a single review

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

name: Create a pull request review

params.name: commit_id
params.description: The SHA of the commit that needs a review. Not using the latest commit SHA may render your review comment outdated if a subsequent commit modifies the line you specify as the `position`. Defaults to the most recent commit in the pull request when you do not specify a value.

params.name: body
params.description: **Required** when using `REQUEST_CHANGES` or `COMMENT` for the `event` parameter. The body text of the pull request review.

params.name: event
params.description: The review action you want to perform. The review actions include: `APPROVE`, `REQUEST_CHANGES`, or `COMMENT`. By leaving this blank, you set the review action state to `PENDING`, which means you will need to [submit the pull request review](https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/reviews/#submit-a-pull-request-review) when you are ready.

params.name: comments
params.description: Use the following table to specify the location, destination, and contents of the draft review comment.

params.name: comments[].path
params.description: **Required.** The relative path to the file that necessitates a review comment.

params.name: comments[].position
params.description: **Required.** The position in the diff where you want to add a review comment. Note this value is not the same as the line number in the file. For help finding the position value, read the note below.

params.name: comments[].body
params.description: **Required.** Text of the review comment.

requests.body: This is close to perfect! Please address the suggested inline change.

comments.body: Please add more information here, and fix this typo.

description:
**Note:** To comment on a specific line in a file, you need to first determine the _position_ of that line in the diff. The GitHub REST API v3 offers the `application/vnd.github.v3.diff` [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media/#commits-commit-comparison-and-pull-requests). To see a pull request diff, add this media type to the `Accept` header of a call to the [single pull request](https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#get-a-single-pull-request) endpoint.

The `position` value equals the number of lines down from the first "@@" hunk header in the file you want to add a comment. The line just below the "@@" line is position 1, the next line is position 2, and so on. The position in the diff continues to increase through lines of whitespace and additional hunks until the beginning of a new file.

body.body: This is close to perfect! Please address the suggested inline change.

params.name: body
params.description: The body text of the pull request review

params.name: event
params.description: **Required.** The review action you want to perform. The review actions include: `APPROVE`, `REQUEST_CHANGES`, or `COMMENT`. When you leave this blank, the API returns _HTTP 422 (Unrecognizable entity)_ and sets the review action state to `PENDING`, which means you will need to re-submit the pull request review using a review action.

body.body: Here is the body for the review.

name: Dismiss a pull request review

params.name: message
params.description: **Required.** The message for the pull request review dismissal

description: **Note:** To dismiss a pull request review on a [protected branch](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/branches/), you must be a repository administrator or be included in the list of people or teams who can dismiss pull request reviews.

body.body: Here is the body for the review.

name: List comments on a pull request

params.name: sort
params.description: Can be either `created` or `updated` comments.

params.name: direction
params.description: Can be either `asc` or `desc`. Ignored without `sort` parameter.

params.name: since
params.description: This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`. Only returns comments `updated` at or after this time.

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: By default, review comments are ordered by ascending ID.

name: List comments in a repository

params.name: sort
params.description: Can be either `created` or `updated` comments.

params.name: direction
params.description: Can be either `asc` or `desc`. Ignored without `sort` parameter.

params.name: since
params.description: This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`. Only returns comments `updated` at or after this time.

params.name: per_page
params.description: Results per page (max 100)

params.name: page
params.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

description: By default, review comments are ordered by ascending ID.

name: Create a comment

params.name: body
params.description: The text of the comment.

params.name: commit_id
params.description: The SHA of the commit needing a comment. Not using the latest commit SHA may render your comment outdated if a subsequent commit modifies the line you specify as the `position`.

params.name: path
params.description: The relative path to the file that necessitates a comment.

params.name: position
params.description: The position in the diff where you want to add a review comment. Note this value is not the same as the line number in the file. For help finding the position value, read the note below.

description:
**Note:** To comment on a specific line in a file, you need to first determine the _position_ of that line in the diff. The GitHub REST API v3 offers the `application/vnd.github.v3.diff` [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media/#commits-commit-comparison-and-pull-requests). To see a pull request diff, add this media type to the `Accept` header of a call to the [single pull request](https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#get-a-single-pull-request) endpoint.

The `position` value equals the number of lines down from the first "@@" hunk header in the file you want to add a comment. The line just below the "@@" line is position 1, the next line is position 2, and so on. The position in the diff continues to increase through lines of whitespace and additional hunks until the beginning of a new file.

name: Create a comment (alternative)

params.name: body
params.description: The text of the comment.

params.name: in_reply_to
params.description: The comment ID to reply to. **Note**: This must be the ID of a _top-level comment_, not a reply to that comment. Replies to replies are not supported.

description:
**Note:** To comment on a specific line in a file, you need to first determine the _position_ of that line in the diff. The GitHub REST API v3 offers the `application/vnd.github.v3.diff` [media type](https://developer.github.com/v3/media/#commits-commit-comparison-and-pull-requests). To see a pull request diff, add this media type to the `Accept` header of a call to the [single pull request](https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/#get-a-single-pull-request) endpoint.

The `position` value equals the number of lines down from the first "@@" hunk header in the file you want to add a comment. The line just below the "@@" line is position 1, the next line is position 2, and so on. The position in the diff continues to increase through lines of whitespace and additional hunks until the beginning of a new file.

params.name: body

params.description: Results per page (max 100)
